title: Marrakech to Zagora
description: Depart Marrakech crossing the High Atlas via Tizi n'Tichka pass (2260m). Stop at Ait Benhaddou, the UNESCO fortress that starred in Gladiator and Game of Thrones. Continue through Ouarzazate and the Draa Valley—Morocco's longest river lined with palm groves and kasbahs. Arrive in Zagora for a sunset camel trek into the dunes.

title: Zagora to Marrakech
description: Wake for sunrise over the desert. After breakfast, return through the Draa Valley with stops at Berber villages and a traditional lunch opportunity. Cross back over the Atlas Mountains, arriving in Marrakech by evening.

title: Marrakech to Dades Valley
description: Cross the High Atlas via Tizi n'Tichka pass. Visit Ait Benhaddou—the ancient caravan route fortress. Continue through Ouarzazate (Hollywood of Africa) and along the Road of a Thousand Kasbahs to the Dades Valley. Watch sunset paint the valley walls orange.

title: Dades to Merzouga
description: Morning walk in Dades Gorge among the finger-like rock formations. Drive through Tinghir to the dramatic Todra Gorge—300m canyon walls just 10m apart. Continue through Berber villages to Merzouga. Late afternoon camel trek into Erg Chebbi for sunset and dinner under the stars.

title: Merzouga to Marrakech
description: Optional sunrise over the dunes. After breakfast, the long scenic drive back—through Rissani (birthplace of the Alaouite dynasty), past underground irrigation channels, over the Atlas. Arrive Marrakech evening.

title: Marrakech to Dades Valley
description: Cross the High Atlas via Tizi n'Tichka pass. Visit Ait Benhaddou—the ancient caravan route fortress. Continue through Ouarzazate and along the Road of a Thousand Kasbahs to the Dades Valley.

title: Dades to Merzouga
description: Morning in Dades Gorge. Drive through Tinghir and Todra Gorge. Continue to Merzouga for camel trek into Erg Chebbi. Dinner and night under the stars in the Sahara.

title: Merzouga to Fes
description: Sunrise over the dunes. After breakfast, drive north through the Ziz Valley—a ribbon of green palms through red canyon walls. Stop at Ifrane (Little Switzerland) and the cedar forests where Barbary macaques live. Arrive Fes evening.

title: Marrakech to Dades Valley
description: Cross the High Atlas via Tizi n'Tichka. Visit Ait Benhaddou and Ouarzazate. Follow the Road of a Thousand Kasbahs to Dades Valley for sunset.

title: Dades to Merzouga
description: Morning walk in Dades Gorge. Drive through Todra Gorge. Afternoon arrival in Merzouga—time to relax before sunset camel trek. Dinner and overnight in desert camp.

title: Merzouga
description: Full day to explore the desert. Options include: 4x4 excursion to nomad families, sandboarding, quad biking, or simply relaxing at the camp. Visit Khamlia village for Gnawa music. Second night in the desert or nearby hotel.

title: Merzouga to Marrakech
description: After sunrise and breakfast, return through Todra Gorge and over the Atlas. Scenic stops along the way. Arrive Marrakech by evening.

title: Marrakech to Dades
description: Cross the High Atlas. Visit Ait Benhaddou and Ouarzazate. Continue to Dades Valley.

title: Dades to Merzouga
description: Explore Dades Gorge. Drive through Todra Gorge to Merzouga. Sunset camel trek and desert camp.

title: Merzouga to Midelt
description: Morning in the desert. Drive through Erfoud and the Ziz Valley. Stop at fossil workshops. Overnight in Midelt at the foot of the Middle Atlas.

title: Midelt to Fes
description: Drive through cedar forests—look for Barbary macaques. Stop at Ifrane before arriving in Fes.

title: Marrakech to Dades
description: Cross the Atlas via Tizi n'Tichka. Ait Benhaddou and Ouarzazate. Dades Valley overnight.

title: Dades to Merzouga
description: Todra Gorge. Sahara sunset. Desert camp.

title: Merzouga to Fes
description: Ziz Valley. Cedar forests. Arrive Fes evening.

title: Fes
description: Full day exploring the world's largest car-free medina. Tanneries, madrasas, craftsmen at work. Optional cooking class.

title: Fes to Marrakech
description: Drive across the Middle Atlas via Beni Mellal. Arrive Marrakech evening.

title: Marrakech to Dades
description: Atlas crossing. Ait Benhaddou. Dades Valley.

title: Dades to Merzouga
description: Todra Gorge. Sahara. Desert camp.

title: Merzouga to Fes
description: Ziz Valley. Cedar forests. Fes.

title: Fes
description: Fes medina exploration with local guide.

title: Fes to Chefchaouen
description: Drive through the Rif Mountains to the blue city.

title: Chefchaouen to Rabat
description: Morning in Chefchaouen. Afternoon drive to Rabat—Morocco's capital.

title: Rabat to Casablanca to Marrakech
description: Hassan Tower and Kasbah of the Udayas in Rabat. Drive to Casablanca for Hassan II Mosque. Continue to Marrakech.

title: Marrakech
description: Morning in Marrakech—Bahia Palace, souks, Jemaa el-Fna. End of tour.

title: Fes to Merzouga
description: Drive south through Ifrane, cedar forests with Barbary macaques, and the dramatic Ziz Valley. Arrive Merzouga for sunset camel trek. Dinner and overnight in desert camp.

title: Merzouga to Fes
description: Sunrise over the dunes. After breakfast, return north via Erfoud and the scenic mountain route. Arrive Fes evening.

title: Fes to Merzouga
description: Through Ifrane and cedar forests to Merzouga. Camel trek and desert camp.

title: Merzouga
description: Full day desert exploration. Nomad visits. Optional 4x4 excursion. Second night at desert hotel.

title: Merzouga to Fes
description: Return via Todra Gorge and Ziz Valley. Arrive Fes evening.

title: Fes to Merzouga
description: Ifrane. Cedar forests. Ziz Valley. Desert camp.

title: Merzouga to Dades
description: Morning desert. Todra Gorge. Dades Valley overnight.

title: Dades to Marrakech
description: Ait Benhaddou. Atlas crossing. Marrakech.
